title: Bariatric Surgery - Northwest Community Healthcare
description: For those who are morbidly obese, this surgery removes or isolates a section of your stomach to help reduce your appetite since you'll feel fuller sooner.
cleaned_text: This type of surgery removes or isolates a section of your stomach. This helps reduce your appetite, as you'll feel fuller sooner. In most cases, this can be a minimally invasive procedure. Bariatric surgery is most often an option for those who are morbidly obese and not just slightly overweight. Our multidisciplinary team will work with you to create a surgery and rehabilitation plan to achieve your weight goals. Our team includes surgeons, medical weight-loss experts, dietitians and nurses. According to studies, most people lose weight and keep it off—making it a reliable, long-term solution. Obesity can be a risk factor in other diseases such as Type 2 diabetes, stroke, high blood pressure and heart disease. Research has shown that bariatric surgery can lower people's risk of dying from weight-related complications. Weight loss has been attributed to improved mobility, mental health and self-esteem. Bariatric surgery can be a good weight-loss option, but it's not usually the first method of treatment recommended. It's the first step in a larger weight-management treatment plan.
